availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: The office of Police Judge, of the town of Somerset, having been vacated by the resignation of the late incumbent, It is therefore ordered that James M. Sandifer be appointed and recommended to his Excellency Thos. E. Bramlette, Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, as a fit and proper person to be by him commissioned, to fill the vacancy occasioned as aforesaid, until the first Monday in August, 1865, the regular time for holding the election for Police Judge of cities and incorporated.

By order of the Board.
R. S. Barron,
Clerk of sd Board.

Police Judge of Somerset
J. M. Sandifer
apptd
2nd Nov/64
